section.title: Registering &rhel; 8 with &rmt;
section.para: Use this procedure to register &rhel; 8 or CentOS Linux 8 with the &rmt; server.

listitem.para: The system you want to register can access the &rmt; server.
You have a valid registration code for &productname;.
You have removed the system from any &rh; subscription services it was registered to.
listitem.remark: Still confirming if this is necessary

step.para: On the system you want to register, download the rmt-client-setup-res script:
Run the rmt-client-setup-res script with the URL of the RMT server as a parameter:
The script performs the following tasks:

listitem.remark: This part fails on sles_es-release because of conflicts between various versions of centos-stream-repos and centos-gpg-keys. It worked when I manually added --skip-broken to the script, but this is not ideal. Could just be Stream-related - need to test.

listitem.para: Downloads and runs the rmt-client-setup script, which does the following:
Imports the keys with gpg --import and rpm --import.
Downloads the CA certificate from https://RMT_SERVER/rmt.crt.
Imports the CA certificate to the trust store.

listitem.remark: I got all the way up to here and then it couldn't detect the base product because I'm testing it on CentOS Stream. I don't have access to a RHEL machine and CentOS Linux 8 (non-Stream) ISOs don't seem to be available anymore.

listitem.para: You should see BaseOS and AppStream.
You should see &sles; with Expanded Support.
Run the update command to make sure there are no errors:

section.para: You can now update your system from repositories provided by &productname;.
